comment: This class was online this semester, and it was fairly easy but the textbook is definitely needed and super helpful. take Simmons over any of the other professors for this course specifically, because the material is challenging and she explains it really well. There are quizzes and tests but they aren't challenging if you pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a really sweet and caring person who genuinely wants to get to know all of her students. The class was pretty easy, but it is a lot of reading and notes to do--don't slack off and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I really liked her class. She engages with the students very well and she is very honest. Attendance is mandatory and late work is not accepted. The hw is easy. She always give you study guides before a test and they are very helpful. Note: If you have anything personal going on or lack test taking skills shes always willing to help.

attendance/participation part of your grade. she did take up most of the class time talking about random stuff. She was asked questions and would rely on the PP or dismiss their question and say something that makes no sense. tests are easy, read the hw online, answer all questions until you get a certain amount of points and you get full credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She spends atleast the first 30 minutes talking about her day and asking others about theres. She tries to joke a little but its just a waste of time . Since she took 30 minutes to talk about nothing she rushes through every slide for no reason. I got a C when I deserved a B. If you can you better form study groups!!! Thats the only .. goodluck
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Heres the thing: Professor Simmons isn't rude. She actually loves her students but she is older so some of the things she says are a bit odd but never come from a place of ill will. I will admit she was all over the place in her lectures but, she is always available to discuss your grade. Try to make it to class consistently on time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: She is a nice professor if you get on her good side. Don't recommend skipping class or God forbid you look at your phone in class. She was very biased in her grading if she didn't or did like you. It didn't seem like she knew what she was talking about. If you do the homework and read the textbook more than you pay attention to her you'll be ok.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Very rude to students; called people out to the point no one wanted to participate in class. Totally contradicted herself when teaching. Wasted the first 20 min of class time. Did not accept doctor's notes. Killed any interest I had in psychology.

I thought I was going to really enjoy this class but I have been very disappointed. She is very rude to students and is very opinionated. Attendance is mandatory. Tests are not that easy, make sure you read material from the text book because that's where she gets a lot of her info from.  She makes reviews for the test but they don't make sense.
rating_tags: LECTURE HEAVY--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Becky was all over the place. We talked about examples for one slide for the first 30 minutes of class, and during the last twenty, she skipped through all the slides. She won't let you bring technology so good luck writing super fast. Tests are primarily over examples from class. Study hard! Don't miss class. Becky doesn't play about that.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Simmons has very interesting lectures and always amused me. Class wasnt that bad just study from the PowerPoints and notes. Enjoyed the course but always make sure to show up to class she calls students out who havent been to many classes!
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Simmons is a nice woman however she seems as if she doesn't know what she is lecturing about. It can be very frustrating if you have a genuine question. She really wants you to participate in discussions so be prepared for discussions!
rating_tags: Caring

comment: I recommend taking Prof. Simmons. She's very nice, and she'll really like you if you sit in the front, always show up, and read the chapter before class. However, her lectures can be confusing. Don't worry, however, since you'll pass the tests if you just read the text. Just be sure to resolve any technical issues with the online software quickly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Simmons isn't a very good professor. She's a nice woman and enjoys teaching the class, but often confuses herself and her students.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: Professor Simmons is very happy to be teaching her class. She is a nice person and will help her students pass. She gets off topic a lot though and sometimes seems like she doesn't know what she is doing. Her presentations get boring.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Her lectures are fun, but sometimes she'll go off on a tangent. Participation really matters, she will literally wait 10 minutes until the class gives an answer. I definitely recommend reading the text before going into class. She says there are no wrong answers, but there are. She can be very condescending. Test are easy if you read the text.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Sometimes rude and obnoxious. You HAVE to participate in class, it's part of you grade. You have to study for tests. Very loud, pronounces words weird.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Simmons doesn't actually teach anything in class she just rambles about random stuff, and is very confusing. The tests aren't that hard but you have to read the book and teach it to yourself because you won't learn anything in class. Attendance is mandatory, but she is kind of funny so going to class isn't that bad.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Simmons is wonderful. There for you. She will literally make you think like oh I had an F and now I have a B? Literally this class is low key interesting and its just easy..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Lectures are heavy, it is important to just read the book before class and to study for the tests. there is online homework but it's not hard to finish. not the hardest class but definitely would not take again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Well.... Where do I start. She doesn't actually teach so be ready to take notes as fast as you can (she zooms through them) and read the textbook! She does online Launch pad assignments.. DO THEM! the test questions often come straight from them. You can get an A B or C but it will take doing a lot on your own sadly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Simmons runs a very respected class. She gives amazing lectures and is so funny. But participation is IMPORTANT. If she knows your name and things you're interested in the class material, shell watch out for you. You definitely have to study which is expected, but she doesn't give super hard tests, you've just got to understand the material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Often contradicts herself. Read the textbook pages before lectures. Attendance is mandatory, but honestly if you study the book there's not much of a reason to go. Class participation is what will drive the lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Prof Simmons isn't one to take if you want a serious in-depth course. She is hilarious and gives loaddsss of examples in class and frequently gets off topic. She does review powerpoints and will help you if you have any questions. You don't need the textbook unless you read ahead. Her lectures come straight from the book.

Hilarious and engaging professor. 3 tests, non-cumulative (one was even open book in my class). Full of personality and makes the dry content more interesting. One power point presentation but it wasn't lengthy. Would HIGHLY recommend taking her class. She is more than willing to help you get the grade you want and gets to know her students.

Great professor. She is willing to do anything to help with your grade. Yes she is late to class most days and sometimes she seems like she does not know what she is talking about. But that is ok if psychology is not your major. If it is I would not recommend her for you. 3 tests & final. 3 minute presentation  that you should get a 100 on. easy A
she knows her stuff, excellent power points id suggest you take notes from her slide. she creates time out of class for students .take her

There's tons of reading. Her powerpoints don't have everything you need to know for tests. That's her way of getting us to read the chapters. She really likes when people speak in class, and she will call on someone if no one talks. There is a powerpoint presentation due at the end of the semester which I didn't like cuz I don't like talking.

Good professor. She has her rules like any other teacher but basically if you go to class and speak up once in a while she'll add that on to your participation grade. Exams are easy, she goes over the powerpoints with the exam material on it. Overall, I'd recommend her. Study the powerpoints before the exam, raise your hand, and you'll pass.

If you want an easy general ed class or a GPA booster then take this class! I never brought the book and only studied on the day of her exams and I made an A. Just go to class. I never participated and received 19.6/20 on participation & attendance. Only assignment is a movie review which is super easy. Most people got 100% on it

She's funny. Pretty simple coursework. Her tests are straight from the PowerPoint. She didn't give a rubric for the Presentations we had to do, so you basically have to guess on what to do & what seems right. Also, she plays favorites. So be a teachers pet to be on the safe side. Attendance/Participation is 20% of your grade.

She could not say a lot of words. She cares about her students and them doing well but does not know what she is talking about. 20% is showing up and "participation". On the last day of class, she walked by every single person and looked at them and rated their "participation". There are over 150 people in the class

I feel like she doesn't want the best for her students. If she did she would have provided her Power Point slides for notes before class. Arrives late. Calls out students. No electronics/food in class whatsoever. Plays favorites. Same seats for the entire semester. Reads from PP slides. Doesn't know what she's talking about.

I would absolutely NOT recommend this professor. She does not answer questions clearly and she doesn't know the material. Gives a bunch of powerpoint slides and you basically have to teach yourself.Test are easy if you study. She can be very rude and mean at times and it is like you're in a kindergarten class. I would not take her ever again!
She's pretty nice and her tests are pretty easy too once you get the hang of how her tests works. No assignments at all except one at the end on a movie we watched in class.

Ms. Simmons definitely cares about her students' success. She makes sure you know exactly what will be on the tests. The tests are all multiple choice and really easy if you study appropriately. Class can be a bit slow sometimes, and she goes through the slides super fast. But this class is an easy A if you show up, read the book, and study.

Do not text in her class. She will not be happy. She will also count you absent if you leave her class early, so I suggest to plan to stick through it. She contradicts herself sometimes, and is very misleading. If you are not planning on going into psychology, take her. But I would still be hesitant.

Yes, this class is easy, but it's easy for a reason. She doesn't know the material she's teaching! I took a high school psych class prior to this & I thought I could have taught the class better than her. She's even taught the material incorrectly! She's late to class & takes forever to start. Treats everyone like kindergartners! DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Yes, this class is easy, but it's easy for a reason. She has no idea what she's talking about. It's like she's learning the material as she teaches the class! I took a highschool psych class before this & I felt like I could have taught the class better than she could. She's always late to class & takes FOREVER to start the class. Don't reccomend.
I absolutely love her, she is very motherly and she tries her best to help you! Just make sure you attend class, don't interrupt or disrespect (texting). You will be fine!!!

Worst teacher ever. I respect most teachers, but this one is simply awful. Doesn't answer questions in class or help students outside of providing misleading power points, and doesn't provide proper information. Don't take her. Even if it's the last class available, wait until the next semester.

Great professor! Always go to class and make sure you participate. She remembers you and makes the class enjoyable if you interact! The tests are straight from the powerpoints and the review slides she sends. You'll have no problem getting an A, and you'll enjoy taking her class!

She is a very nice person. Her tests are mostly straight from the powerpoints and the review tells you which slides to study. Tests are fair and she is quick to help, emails back pretty quickly. I would take her again with another psyc class if I could. If you study, you'll get an A.

The class is easy. You take notes from the PowerPoint. She goes over a review PowerPoint before the test, which is basically your study guide for the test. Attendance is mandatory. She wants her students to pass, and it's easy to do so.
She's a pretty good professor. She even gives reviews for her tests and if you know those, you'll get an A. Kind of sarcastic but if she likes you, she'll be very nice to you.
She is a good professor, she is funny, Attendance is mandatory and she expects you to read the book prior to class. Overall a decent Professor with a sense of humor.

Easy class, but she can be unclear in explanations. Must be in class and participate bc attendance is weighted almost the same as a final. The tests come primarily from her slides, but occasionally the slides are her opinion on subject matter. Overall she's an ok teacher who genuinely wants her students to do well

Honestly, you want to take this professor if you want an A. She is hilarious and really does want her students to make a good grade. Bought the book, never used it. As long as you come to class you know whats going to be on the test. Attendence is not mandatory BUT it is part of you class grade so go to class!! Easy clss, easy A, amazing professor!

She is a very nice lady and she is genuinely committed to making her students pass... BUT she isn't very clear and she has a informal approach. Easy. Straight forward. Not a big deal. Rarely used the book but buy it because she checks if you have it.

I don't see what the fuss is about. Sure, she's a little late often, but it's not that big of a deal. The material still gets covered and she's a nice lady. Read your book. Study the power-points. Take advantage of the few very easy extra credit opportunities. Easy A.

This teacher is ridiculous, she always walks into class atleast 5 sometimes 10 mins late. Then takes half the class to get ready then yells out us cause we cant move through slides fast enough... Never really prepared for class and doesnt seem familiar with the material. Not happy with this class at all.

She is a very nice lady, but her  lectures can be a little boring. Her tests are pretty consistent with what is on her power points. If you have attended class she will help you out with your grade in the end. She offers a little extra credit. Overall she isn't that bad, she just isn't great at explaining things.

Poor communication, tries to teach a lecture hall like it's a class of 15 kindergarteners. Doesn't know how to pronounce the words on the slide (deoxyribonucleic,for example), and I learned absolutely nothing.
Very nice and caring. She honestly wants her students to pass. Her exams are not very difficult, and the content comes mostly from the power point slides she presents in class.
This professor is a very nice professor. She really does want you to succeed. And the tests are really easy too; just study the powerpoints and read (yes I said read) the chapters and you'll be fine.
She is awesome and funny!!!!!

I think she is hilarious and is so interesting. If you pay attention and do what she says you will be fine. She switches up how she does tests because she likes to know who is paying attention. She is hilarious, and yeah she can not pronounce words well but no one is perfect. Recommend her.

She is very respectful and nice to everyone in the class, but I found this class to be rather unorganized. She was new and it showed. Overall it isn't that hard to succeed, but you can't really slack off and get an A either. Based on all the experiences I had in her class, I cannot recommend this professor to someone genuinely interested in psych.

Ms. Simmons is a very nice professor! She was very reasonable & for the most part she allowed us to teach the class & make decisions.Eventhough attendance was vital,class was very interesting because we had open discussions in class everytime!She didn't know the material at all,but what should anyone care when we were allowed to tell her?? Easy A+

Do not take her! She does not know the material that she covers in class. Asks the students what words mean and how to pronounce them. I do believe that she has good intentions, but she has never taught before. If you dont like to sit in class and listen to someone read to you straight from the slide and inconsistent test materials DONT TAKE HER!

This lady is crazy! DO NOT TAKE HER!! she is new to teaching and doesnt know anything about how to teach. She asked our class numerous times how to pronounce words...seriously. Easy class if you study but attendance is important.

Never taught before, is unprepared, very confusing. Slides are taken verbatim from textbook. It would appear as though she has never taken a psych class in her life as she can't pronounce half the words. Yet, she loves teaching and wants to help her students. Extremely easy class get the A for your GPA if you can handle her as a teacher.

She means well, and you can tell she loves her job, but she is not a good professor. She's never taught before, so she has no idea what she's doing. She's very unclear about assignments. Tests are confusing unreflective of material covered in class. Gives out random grades on the paper. Take another professor if you want an A.
